line-7: Our passengers and freight users are at the heart of everything we do. We help connect people to their friends and families and get goods to their destination safely and efficiently. We're an organisation where people matter.  Watch our video to find out more!We're continuing to build a diverse organisation which is representative of the people we serve. We want to harness the skills and expertise of our people and attract the best talent, to enable a safe and accessible railway for everyone. To learn why inclusion is important to us, please click here.About our people and the recruitment process - We're an inclusive employer of choice and we welcome applications from everyone!  We encourage our colleagues to work flexibly, as we know traditional working patterns don't always fit. If you want to consider working flexibly, just let us know and we'll do our best to help and invest in your career with us, whilst you have a healthy work life balance. We're also a Disability Confident Leader employer and we'll try our best to adapt the process and offer a reasonable alternative to help support people with disabilities access, apply and interview for roles.
line-9: Lead and direct the stores management team within the Delivery Unit.  Provide plant and materials to delivery unit teams to support all work activities.
line-11: Key Accountabilities:  1.       Lead and direct the stores management team to achieve Key Performance measures.2.       Manage development and engagement of the team and individuals.3.       Manage staff safety and competence arrangements.4.       Assist the Logistics Co-ordinator to establish efficient quantities of plant and materials.5.       Operate an efficient goods receipt and returns process. Maintain accurate inventory records of stocks booked in and out of stores. 6.       Order stock and material replenishment via corporate processes and systems.   7.       Conduct stock-taking checks and assist with stock audits.  Monitor and amend stock profiles and levels as demand requires. 8.       Operate out-based Minor Stocking Points.9.       Maintain safe and tidy stores areas10.    Prepare and make available plant and materials to delivery unit teams.11.    Collaborate with technical support units to comply with equipment calibration requirements.  12.    Quarantine small plant, tools and equipment out of test date.13.    Check small plant, tools and equipment are fit for purpose.  Quarantine plant, tools and equipment that is not fit for purpose and arrange replacement.Job Skills, Experience and Qualifications:  Essential�       Knowledge of plant and tools specification�       Practical competence in loading and lifting operations and equipment�       Knowledge of relevant standards and procedures�       Knowledge of relevant Company IT systems�       Good communication and organisation skills Desirable�       Knowledge of operational railway�       Knowledge of maintenance delivery processes and techniques
